decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (PL 202470/01 received: 14 March 2017. PL 202470/03 Rev 1, unnumbered Reflective Sound Screens Specification Sheet, and Noise Assessment JAE9071 received: 3 April 2017. PL 202470/01 Rev 1 and PL 202470/03 Rev 2 received 9 May 2017) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the structure hereby permitted shall match those approved in unnumbered Reflective Sound Screens Specification Sheet received: 3 April 2017.

Condition : 4 - The acoustic barrier hereby permitted should meet the stated specification to achieve a transmission loss of at least 19dB and meet Category B2 of the specification stated in 'BS EN 1793-2:1998 'Road traffic noise reducing devices Part 2: Intrinsic characteristics of airborne sound insulation'. The barrier should have minimum height above the ground level of the courts of 3 metres with no gaps or openings.
description: Erection of an acoustic barrier fence between a tennis court and the rear residential dwellings to reduce the noise level.
